description: Check if you can become an approved driving instructor (ADI) and what you need to do to qualify.

details.body:
Check if you can become an approved driving instructor (ADI) in Great Britain and find out:

  • what you need to do to qualify
  • what rules apply if you have an automatic or manual licence

There’s a different process to qualify in Northern Ireland.

nodes.title: Are you registered as a driving instructor in either Northern Ireland or an EU country?
Have you had a full car driving licence for at least 3 years?
Have you been banned (disqualified) from driving in the last 4 years?
What type of car is your driving licence for?

nodes.body:
1. Apply to register your non-GB driving licence if you got yours in an EU country.

  2. Apply to the Driver and Vehicle Standards Agency (DVSA) to transfer your instructor registration.

Register your non-GB driving licence

Download and fill in D9 - Application to register a non-GB driving licence and send it to DVLA.

DVLA
Swansea
SA99 1BH

Transfer your registration

When you’ve registered your non-GB licence you can transfer your driving instructor registration to Great Britain.

You must read the ADI register guide.
nodes.title: You can apply to transfer your driving instructor registration to Great Britain

nodes.body:
You have to be 21 or older to supervise a learner driver.

You can usually apply to start the qualifying process 6 months before your 21st birthday. This is because it will take at least 6 months to qualify as an ADI.

It’s against the law for you to charge a fee to teach someone to drive if you’re not an ADI.
nodes.title: You cannot become an approved driving instructor (ADI) until you're 21

nodes.body:
You have to have had your full licence for at least 3 years to supervise a learner driver.

You can usually apply to start the qualifying process 6 months before the 3rd anniversary of getting your full licence. This is because it will take at least 6 months to qualify as an ADI.

It’s against the law for you to charge a fee to teach someone to drive if you’re not an ADI.
nodes.title: You cannot become an approved driving instructor (ADI) until you've had a full licence for 3 years or more

nodes.body:
You can apply 4 years after your ban has ended.

You’ll need to tell DVSA about the ban when you apply. They take motoring offences into account when deciding if you’re suitable to become a driving instructor.

It’s against the law for you to charge a fee to teach someone to drive if you’re not an ADI.
nodes.title: You cannot apply to become an approved driving instructor (ADI) yet

nodes.body:
You’re eligible to apply to become an ADI.

Motoring offences and other convictions

Your application can be refused if you have:

  • been banned from driving
  • 5 or more penalty points
  • been convicted of any non-motoring offences

The ADI Registrar will consider whether or not you’re suitable to become a driving instructor.

Your application is unlikely to be accepted if you’ve been:

  • convicted of a sexual, violent, financial or drug-related crime
  • banned from working with children
nodes.title: You can start applying to become an approved driving instructor (ADI)

nodes.body:
You’re eligible to apply to become an ADI.

If you want to teach in a manual car

You must pass the car driving test in a manual car first.

If you have a disability

You might need to take an extra assessment if you’ve got an automatic licence because you have a disability. This is to prove that you can keep control of your car in an emergency.

The Driver and Vehicle Standards Agency (DVSA) will tell you if you need to do this.

Motoring offences and other convictions

Your application can be refused if you have:

  • been banned from driving
  • 5 or more penalty points
  • been convicted of any non-motoring offences

The ADI Registrar will consider whether or not you’re suitable to become a driving instructor.

Your application is unlikely to be accepted if you’ve been:

  • convicted of a sexual, violent, financial or drug-related crime
  • banned from working with children
